tool.name: TiltAngle

param.name: input_raster
param.dialogReference: Input magnetic or gravity raster dataset for tilt angle calculation.

param.name: buffer_size
param.dialogReference: Buffer zone size for edge effect reduction during derivative calculations.

tool.summary: Calculate tilt angle derivative for edge detection and structural mapping
tool.usage:
The tilt angle (tilt derivative) is calculated as arctan(dz/sqrt(dx² + dy²)) where dz is the vertical derivative and dx, dy are horizontal derivatives. Results range from -90° to +90°.

Interpretation:

• Positive values indicate source locations

• Negative values indicate background regions

• Zero contours mark geological contacts and edges

• Independent of magnetic field direction and source magnetization

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The tilt angle derivative transforms geophysical data to enhance edge detection and structural mapping. Values range from -90° to +90° with zero contours indicating geological contacts.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Edge detection, structural mapping, and geological contact delineation in magnetic and gravity surveys.
dataIdInfo.useLimit: Best results with high-quality, low-noise data. May amplify noise in areas of low signal. Consider applying upward continuation for noise reduction before tilt angle calculation.
